TopicTitle: If the New Parts are as powerful as People say...

Articles.Content: Then my launcher will get a insane upgrade.
do wing panels generate lift going straight up? or is that all just added weight?
I'm pretty sure everyone's launcher is going to get an insane upgrade. What's the point of this thread? Are you advertising? Bragging? Want inspirational pictures?

do wing panels generate lift going straight up? or is that all just added weight?

Based on what I know about KSP's aerodynamics (if you can even call them that), they will do absolutely nothing while the rocket is facing prograde, and still not do much when it is not.

Based on what I know about KSP's aerodynamics (if you can even call them that), they will do absolutely nothing while the rocket is facing prograde, and still not do much when it is not.

They do add stability on rockets that lack control from SAS or trust vectoring. Eg..... that 1 career mode rocket you make with a large SRB and no SAS units.

If your rocket is already stable enough to not spin or flip upside-down during launch, then they don't do a lot.

Based on what I know about KSP's aerodynamics (if you can even call them that), they will do absolutely nothing while the rocket is facing prograde, and still not do much when it is not.

this. when i first got ksp i tried making a airfoil out of the bis 2x2 panels, then i found out only certain parts generate lift. while my original idea will never happen, better stock aerodymanics would be lovely
I do think its about time Squad made FAR stock.
My launcher got smaller o_O It has almost exactly the same capacity, but I achieved it with a lot fewer parts, including fewer parachutes. Oh, and of course way fewer struts.

If you have a question about the update, please post it in Gameplay Questions. If you want to show off your ship, please add a craft file and post it in Ship Exchange. But since this thread seems to serve no purpose as it is, closing for now.
